meanings.definition: A person who sells hardware, especially iron goods.
meanings.sent1: The ironmonger at the store helped me find the perfect nails for my project.
meanings.sent2: I visited the local ironmonger to buy some new tools for my workshop.
meanings.sent3: The ironmonger joked that he could 'nail' any problem I had with his products.
meanings.sent4: She was a true ironmonger, forging strong relationships with her customers.
meanings.sent5: The ironmonger's shop was filled with the clang of metal and the smell of oil.

meanings.definition: A shop or store selling iron goods.
meanings.sent1: I need to stop by the ironmonger to pick up some screws for the project.
meanings.sent2: The old ironmonger on the corner has been in business for decades.
meanings.sent3: The ironmonger's shop was like a treasure trove of metal wonders.
meanings.sent4: The ironmonger's store stood out among the other shops on the street.
meanings.sent5: Walking into the ironmonger's shop felt like stepping back in time.

meanings.definition: To engage in the business of selling iron goods.
meanings.sent1: He decided to ironmonger after learning the art of blacksmithing.
meanings.sent2: She plans to ironmonger in the new market that just opened up.
meanings.sent3: The young entrepreneur was eager to ironmonger and make a name for himself.
meanings.sent4: Ironmongering requires a good knowledge of different types of metal.
meanings.sent5: The family business had been ironmongering for generations, passing down their skills.
